Parents: I’m sure many of you heard that TPS has decided to start their year fully virtual as well as push their calendar back to September 8th just like we have. I know you have many questions on how this will affect us in our decision making process, but at this time I am not planning on doing anything differently until we have some time to process this new information. We have five weeks until school starts. I don’t want to make a knee jerk reaction until I’ve had some time to think on it, talk with the staff, and survey all of you.

I’m going to talk with the board about it at our meeting tonight and get their thoughts, and I will schedule another meeting with the staff soon. I certainly respect what Toledo Public is doing, but I also think that we can move forward with a hybrid model safely if it is done right. That said, a lot can happen in five weeks, and how we feel today might not be how we feel in a month or even a few days.

I will send out more communication soon. Thank you.

-Mr. Campbell

post_text: Parents: TPS came out with their plan for the fall today, and I’m sure many of you are wondering when our plan will be released and what it will entail. While we are still working out the details, our plan will include options for parents who need their children to be physically present as well as those who want their students to be educated completely virtually. We feel this flexibility is important to accommodate the needs of all of our families. We do not anticipate having a hybrid plan like TPS where students are only coming to school certain days of the week, but rather we will have in school education all five days, but we will have virtual options available for anyone who needs or wants it. That’s all the detail I can go into at this time, as we are still working through many of the unanswered questions we need to resolve before giving you our full-fledged plan, but I wanted to be sure to communicate with all of you that we are working tirelessly to ensure that we can accommodate the needs of all of our families.

Dear parents,

Do what you can and don’t stress about the rest. As teachers, we are no strangers to filling in learning gaps. We will get your kids back on track when we return to school. In the mean time, do the best you can with school work, hug them tight for us, and make memories laughing together. We’re here for you! Please keep messaging us with any questions you have.
Love,
Your Discovery SPED team
